definition: banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]

sentences.english: Well, all the same stuff as in the Apple store half a mile away on Regent Street.
sentences.chinese: 半公里外的攝政街蘋果旗艦店也有同樣的商品。

sentences.english: The restaurant decor will mimic that of the flagship shop in Taipei, mixing fashion with Chinese elements.
sentences.chinese: 餐廳格調會和臺北旗艦店幾本一致，混合中國風元素。

sentences.english: The Eslite Bookstore is to open a new flagship store for the Chinese New Year.
sentences.chinese: 誠品書局在農曆新年時將開設一家新的旗艦店。

sentences.english: The firm has just opened a flagship store in Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 這家公司剛在上海開了一家旗艦店。

sentences.english: Flagships are meant to overshadow its sister stores in its area.
sentences.chinese: 旗艦店的光芒會遮住其他在同一地區的姐妹店。

sentences.english: My way of life House Home.
Barbie Shanghai is located at 550 Central Huaihai Road.
sentences.chinese: 芭比上海旗艦店位於上海市淮海中路550號。

sentences.english: I wanted to express the character of Issey Miyake's obsession with the pleat in this flagship store.
sentences.chinese: 我想表達的特點三宅一生的癡迷與褶在這旗艦店。

sentences.english: McDull flagship store is expected to open in Shanghai later this year.
sentences.chinese: 預計今年晚些時候將於上海開設一家麥兜的旗艦店。

sentences.english: This will be Bosideng’s first overseas down apparel and menswear flagship store.
sentences.chinese: 這將是該公司首次於海外開設羽絨服及男裝旗艦店。

sentences.english: With the advantage of the Internet opened the famous Swiss online Sang flagship store.
sentences.chinese: 藉助於互聯網的優勢在網絡開設了名人瑞裳旗艦店。

sentences.english: In addition to this flagship store, there are two other Sinzd locations in the Zhongshan area.
sentences.chinese: 除了這家旗艦店，在中山市還有2家。

definition: to enter and garrison/(fig.) to establish a presence in
to open a business/to open a practice/open (for business)
to offer (goods or services)/to open (for business etc)
